body_html: I just found the problem was caused from the unstable RAM (using the CRC checking for tfrecord here: https://gist.github.com/ed-alertedh/9f49bfc6216585f520c7c7723d20d951). After I downgrade the memory frequency from 3066 to 2800 in BIOS, it works fine now.
body_text: I just found the problem was caused from the unstable RAM (using the CRC checking for tfrecord here: https://gist.github.com/ed-alertedh/9f49bfc6216585f520c7c7723d20d951). After I downgrade the memory frequency from 3066 to 2800 in BIOS, it works fine now.
body: I just found the problem was caused from the unstable RAM (using the CRC checking for tfrecord here: https://gist.github.com/ed-alertedh/9f49bfc6216585f520c7c7723d20d951). After I downgrade the memory frequency from 3066 to 2800 in BIOS, it works fine now.
